Create dummy variables

Source: R/rbin-create-bins.R
rbin_create.Rd

Create dummy variables from bins.

rbin_create(data, predictor, bins)

Arguments

data

A data.frame or tibble.
predictor

Variable for which dummy variables must be created.
bins

An object of class rbin_manual or rbin_quantiles or rbin_equal_length or rbin_winsorized.

Value

data with dummy variables.

Examples

k <- rbin_manual(marketing_bank, y, age, c(29, 31, 34, 36, 39, 42, 46, 51, 56))
rbin_create(marketing_bank, age, k)
#> # A tibble: 4,521 x 26
#>      age job      marital education default balance housing loan  contact   day
#>    <int> <fct>    <fct>   <fct>     <fct>     <dbl> <fct>   <fct> <fct>   <int>
#>  1    34 technic~ married tertiary  no          297 yes     no    cellul~    29
#>  2    49 services married secondary no          180 yes     yes   unknown     2
#>  3    38 admin.   single  secondary no          262 no      no    cellul~     3
#>  4    47 services married secondary no          367 yes     no    cellul~    12
#>  5    51 self-em~ single  secondary no         1640 yes     no    unknown    15
#>  6    40 unemplo~ married secondary no         3382 yes     no    unknown    14
#>  7    58 retired  married secondary no         1227 no      no    cellul~    14
#>  8    32 unemplo~ married primary   no          309 yes     no    teleph~    13
#>  9    46 blue-co~ married secondary no          922 yes     no    teleph~    18
#> 10    32 services married tertiary  no            0 no      no    cellul~    21
#> # ... with 4,511 more rows, and 16 more variables: month <fct>, duration <int>,
#> #   campaign <int>, pdays <int>, previous <int>, poutcome <fct>, y <fct>,
#> #   `age_<_31` <dbl>, `age_<_34` <dbl>, `age_<_36` <dbl>, `age_<_39` <dbl>,
#> #   `age_<_42` <dbl>, `age_<_46` <dbl>, `age_<_51` <dbl>, `age_<_56` <dbl>,
#> #   `age_>=_56` <dbl>
